SEARCH
Package io.shiromi.saml.types

Class NumberType

java.lang.Object
io.shiromi.saml.types.AbstractType<Number>
io.shiromi.saml.types.NumberType
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public final class NumberType extends AbstractType<Number>
Instances of the class NumberType carry a Number as value, meaning any numeric value Java allows, e.g. int could be used as an argument for the constructor, however, regardless of the type given as parameter, it will always be cast to double, the reason why AbstractType.getValue() is of type Double, the primary use of this class is for MathUtils or YamlNumber objects as well as a YamlArray of type NumberType

Each NumberType can have its value cast to the primitive number types defined by Java, which could also be done via using the MathUtils bindTo functions.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Shiromi
See Also:

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final NumberType
    MAX_VALUE
    This NumberType stores the maximum double value 0x1.FFFFFFFFFFFFFP1023, or in integer notation (2-2-52)×2127, equal to the double max value
    static final NumberType
    MIN_VALUE
    This NumberType stores the minimum double value 0x0.0000000000001P-1022, or in integer notation 2-1074, equal to the double min value
    static final NumberType
    NaN
    This NumberType stores a Not-a-Number (NaN) value, equal to the result of 0.0d / 0.0
    static final NumberType
    NEGATIVE_INFINITY
    This NumberType stores the value of -Infinity, equal to the result of -1.0d / 0.0
    static final NumberType
    POSITIVE_INFINITY
    This NumberType stores the value of Infinity, equal to the result of 1.0d / 0.0
    private double

    • parse

      @Contract("_ -> new") @NotNull public static @NotNull NumberType parse(@NotNull @NotNull String s) throws NumberFormatException
      Parses a string, could be Hexadecimal or Decimal to a NumberType 
      
      NumberType a, b, c;
      a = NumberType.parse("0x1F"); // 31
      b = NumberType.parse("31"); // 31
      c = NumberType.parse("Number") // throws error
      Parameters:
      s - the string to parse
      Returns:
      a NumberType with the parsed value
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - if the input String is not valid
